sect1.title: Using plugins
sect1.para: &app; has a special menu for plugins, where the active plugins can make accessible its features. When a game is first created, only the Plugin Navigator will be active, you can then activate the rest with it.

The Plugin Navigator is the graphical frontend of the plugin manager, a piece of software that manages all available plugins for &gwp;. As you can see on , the Plugin Navigator shows the list of available plugins so that you can click on the toggle button on the left to activate or deactivate as necessary.

figure.title: The Plugin Navigator, used to activate and deactivate plugins

sect1.para: When activated, a plugin can register its actions in various forms, for example: it can register some action to be done when you press some keystroke, or when a specific event is received, or even when you select the action from the Plugins menu. Each plugin will have its own kind of behaviour.
When closed, &app; will remember the list of active plugins and will activate them at game load, so you don't have to.
If you want to add some plugin to &app;, you simply have to create the ~/.gwp/plugins/ directory, and place it there, it'll added to the Navigator on the next execution.
